general.headline: Developer Advocate, Software Engineer - Microsoft Azure Cloud
general.description: Bernd is a Product Manager, Developer Advocate and Software Engineer with over 10 years of experience in cloud computing. As a technology evangelist Bernd uniquely combines technical rigor, attention to detail, creativity, enthusiam for technology, passion for people, teaching & mentorship, public speaking, and cross-cultural awareness.At Microsoft, Bernd is part of the Azure Cloud team and currently holds the position of Cloud Developer Advocate specializing in Linux, Containers, Python and open source software. In this capacity Bernd not only works with product and engineering teams within Microsoft to create a world-class developer experience, but also travels to conferences and events domestic and abroad to reach as many software engineers as possible through presentations and conversations.Bernd joined Microsoft from the U.S. Federal Government where he worked on the 18F innovation team under former president Obama to create modern cloud computing technology infrastructure for the government. Other positions he held include roles at Google on the Google Cloud Platform team, at Twitter on advertising technology infrastructure and partnerships, and positions at several startups (for example in the financial fraud detection space).As a dual citizen (Germany & US) - a native of Germany and adult immigrant to the US - and having had extensive experiences abroad including a several months long stay in China, Bernd is well-versed in cross-cultural awareness and communication. This makes Bernd a natural international leader - a bridge between cultures.Bernd's personal interests extend beyond technology and include career mentorship, jazz piano, distance running, Chinese culture and language. He is a native speaker of German, has native-level proficiency in English, understands spoken Dutch, and is making good progress on learning Mandarin Chinese.

jobs.description:
The mission of the Cloud Developer Advocacy team is to win the hearts and minds of Developers and IT Operators to secure the future of the Microsoft Azure platform. The Cloud Developer Advocacy team is first and foremost pivoted on enabling a healthy ecosystem for technical communities targeting Azure.

As a key stakeholder for the overall developer experience I am embedded into several product and engineering teams across the vast IaaS and PaaS developer offerings of the Microsoft Azure cloud.

My technology focus is on Linux, Containers (in particular the Kubernetes orchestrator), and Python. As of the beginning of 2019 I have a somewhat generalist charter with focus on the academic field -- students, faculty and researchers.

18F is a civic consultancy for the government, inside the government, working with agencies to rapidly deploy tools and services that are easy to use, cost efficient, and reusable. Our goal is to change how the government buys and develops digital services by helping agencies adopt modern techniques that deliver superior products.

We are transforming government from the inside out, creating cultural change by working with teams inside agencies who want to create great services for the public.
On the Products and Platforms team we incubate high-demand products and platforms for the Office of Citizen Services and Innovative Technology (OCSIT) to scale and institutionalize across government.

Job Description:
As an Innovation Specialist, the incumbent serves the government and makes an impact on a truly massive scale. The position requires that fellows perform work of an exceptional degree of difficulty across a wide range of topics at the convergence of technology, policy, and delivery. The incumbent leverages their experience deploying high-quality, user-centric platforms and services to lead major initiatives, consult on systems and policy proposals, and provide technical, policy, and programmatic guidance to government.

More specifically, I am the technical account manager / solutions engineer for cloud.gov, a platform-as-a-service for government agency developers. I handle everything from sales engineering, interagency contracts, internal tools development and business operations to developer support and onboarding.

Nylas removes the pain of integrating your app with email, contacts, and calendars. It’s a modern developer platform that lets you ship faster with fewer bugs.
We connect to Microsoft Exchange, ActiveSync, IMAP, SMTP, and MIME for you. Create awesome apps that work for all users with just one API.
Nylas is also the creator of N1, an open-source mail client built on the modern web with Electron, React, and Flux. It is designed to be extensible, so it's easy to create new experiences and workflows around email. N1 is built on the Nylas Sync Engine which is also open source free software.
